Jordan makes a small fortune thanks to his aggressive pitching style and high commissions at Investor's Center, specializing in pink sheet penny stocks.

Investigation by the FBI into Jordan Belfort's activities at Stratton Oakmont.
Jordan opens a Swiss bank account in the name of Emma to hide his money. Emma lives in London and is outside the immediate reach of American authorities.
Heated argument between Brad and Donnie during a money exchange, resulting in Brad's arrest while Donnie escapes.
Jordan uses Chantalle and her family to smuggle cash into Switzerland, as they have European passports.
Jordan's private investigator Bo Dietl informs Jordan that the FBI is wiretapping his phones, which causes Jordan to consider leaving Stratton Oakmont.
Max advises Jordan to leave Stratton Oakmont and lie low while his lawyer negotiates a deal to keep him out of prison.
Jordan makes $22 million in three hours after securing the IPO of Steve Madden, bringing him and his firm further FBI attention.
Donnie's childhood friendship with Steve Madden, which Jordan takes advantage of by securing the IPO for him.
In 1996, Jordan's wife Emma dies of a heart attack. Jordan learns of her death while on a yacht trip to Italy.
Jordan goes to Switzerland to forge Emma's name and save their account before going to London for the funeral.
To bypass border patrols, Jordan orders his yacht captain Ted to sail to Monaco.
Jordan and his wives are on their yacht when they learn of Emma's death. Jordan orders Ted to sail to Monaco from Italy.
Their ship capsizes in a storm while en route to Geneva after their rescue.
A plane is sent to take Jordan and his wives to Geneva, but it is destroyed when a seagull flies into the engine. Jordan takes this as a sign from God.
After his wife's death, Jordan starts to address his worsening drug addiction and attempts to sober up.
Saurel and Koskoff are arrested for an unrelated crime in the given context.
Saurel informs the FBI about Jordan as a plea bargain.
Jordan agrees to gather evidence from his colleagues in exchange for leniency.
Naomi tells Jordan that she is divorcing him and wants full custody of their children.
In a cocaine-fueled rage, Jordan punches Naomi and tries to drive away with his daughter but crashes his car in the driveway.
